intro: Cirsium scolopendron, commonly known as the hedgehog thistle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its spiny, upright stems and purple to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has deeply lobed, rough-textured leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges. Cirsium scolopendron is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
